meanings.definition: A city or urban area characterized by a high population density and diverse cultural influences.
meanings.sent1: The bustling slurban was filled with people from different cultures.
meanings.sent2: I love exploring the vibrant slurban areas with all the different foods and traditions.
meanings.sent3: In the slurban, you can find a mix of languages being spoken on every corner.
meanings.sent4: The slurban was a melting pot of cultures, blending together seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The slurban was like a colorful tapestry woven with threads of various traditions.

meanings.definition: To make something more urban in style or character.
meanings.sent1: She decided to slurban her apartment by adding modern decor and city-inspired artwork.
meanings.sent2: The town council voted to slurban the park by installing new benches and streetlights.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would slurban his wardrobe by wearing a tie with his jeans.
meanings.sent4: Her music had a unique blend of genres, slurbaning the traditional sound with urban beats.
meanings.sent5: The artist's latest painting seemed to slurban the countryside scene into a cityscape.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a city or urban environment.
meanings.sent1: The slurban lifestyle was fast-paced and full of excitement.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the slurban vibe of downtown over the quiet suburbs.
meanings.sent3: The slurban architecture combined modern skyscrapers with historic buildings.
meanings.sent4: His fashion sense had a slurban flair, mixing streetwear with classic styles.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti art added a slurban touch to the once plain walls of the alley.
